title: Several native integration tests using JDK provided service provider implementations from modules fail with latest Graal master
body:
### Describe the bug

We see a couple of quarkus integration tests failing with latest GraalVM master:

### Elytron Security LDAP

```
2022-12-21 03:08:50,246 ERROR [io.qua.ver.htt.run.QuarkusErrorHandler] (executor-thread-0) HTTP Request to /api/requiresAdminRole failed, error id: 03e5088d-47fb-4128-b7f5-b1024c6f372d-1: java.lang.RuntimeException: org.wildfly.security.auth.server.RealmUnavailableException: ELY01125: Ldap-backed realm failed to obtain context
```

### JPA Oracle

This is a bit more cryptic but it looks like it boils down to LDAP again
```
Response body doesn't match expectation.
Expected: is "OK"
  Actual: An error occurred while attempting ldap operations
```

### Expected behavior

Tests pass.

### Actual behavior

Tests fail.

### How to Reproduce?

Run those quarkus integration tests in native mode with latest graalvm master.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux

### Output of `java -version`

JDK 17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

Graal VM master (rev 16c4eaaf32a525ac327bc596927d96ca70f0e16a)

### Quarkus version or git rev

`main` branch

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

This seems to be caused by: https://github.com/oracle/graal/pull/5601

Confirmed with GHA runs prior and after the change.

Revision just before the change (good): 5f0ff219a77797d08a0cea57ea773b513c30237f
https://github.com/graalvm/mandrel/actions/runs/3749623804

Last commit of this change (bad): 56877161d7f964099112b9a251579391412f3413
https://github.com/graalvm/mandrel/actions/runs/3749641198
